report_title: Product Design Services in the US
executive_summary: Product design services have continued to swell up as the constant technological change and consumer preferences have forced downstream markets to adjust and roll out new products. The pandemic proved to be a catalyst for growth as a rapid shift towards a digital landscape caused companies to shift their focus to new product lines.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: A Shift in Preferences Becomes the Catalyst for Growth
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The COVID-19 pandemic forced downstream businesses to change their product offerings to accommodate the shift in environmental and consumer behaviors. This allowed product designers to thrive as companies were seeking ways to maneuver through a more digital environment.

Amid the pandemic, interest rates plummeted, allowing clients to pour more money into product design services, causing a massive uptick in revenue. As the economy began to recover, inflationary concerns caused headwinds as the Federal Reserve pushed up rates to combat this.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As interest rates are set to contract following spikes amid inflation, the cost of borrowing will be lower, allowing many different industries to roll out new products. With the vast number of industries and niche consumer audiences, more product design services will pop up to assist with the process.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: TECHNOLOGY PLAYS A PIVOTAL ROLE IN DEVELOPMENT
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As technology advances rapidly, end users will require assistance from product designers to help incorporate it into their future products. Designers are also shifting into a digital landscape and adjusting accordingly.

industry_definition: Operators in this industry develop designs and specifications for mass-produced products.

negative_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level: low - increasing

opportunities: High Performance Drivers: Research and development expenditure
threats: Low Revenue Growth (2005-2024): Low Outlier Growth - Demand from computer and electronic product manufacturing

key_trends: Downstream markets are committing to sustainability amid rising environmental concerns. Product design services can help pinpoint areas in which companies can make their products more environmentally friendly, whether at the design stage or in the supply chain.

While growth has been consistent for product designs, the highs of the pandemic began to wear off toward the end of the period amid inflationary concerns. Rising interest rates caused clients to reduce spending on product design as corporate profit took a hit.

Copyright regulation protects work done by product design teams to ensure original ideas will not be stolen. Under the Hague Agreement, an applicant can file for intellectual property rights with a member country that signed the agreement. The design will be protected in as many member countries as desired if approved.

market_segmentation.segment: Automobile Makers Look to Innovate Every Year
market_segmentation.segment_description: Automobile and parts manufacturers consistently rely on product design services to create new cutting-edge vehicles or upgraded parts. Most automakers release new versions of their vehicles every year and rely on product designers who specialize in the automobile industry to help pinpoint trends in technology and consumer preferences to ensure success.

market_segmentation.segment: Technology Trends Cause Electronic Manufacturers to Innovate Products
market_segmentation.segment_description: Like automobile manufacturers, many computer and electronic manufacturers release new or upgraded products annually. Designers can help companies research and target areas that need upgrades or refinement. They also find ways to reduce purchase costs by finding materials that can reduce costs without affecting performance. Design teams will rely on historical and ongoing technology trends to determine how a product might do in the future.

market_segmentation.segment: Medical Equipment Seeks Upgrades Amid Health Trends
market_segmentation.segment_description: Medical equipment manufacturers use product design services to create easy to use and cost-effective equipment. Designers will research regulations and ensure that products don't break any rules. They also advise on different types of material depending on the purpose of the equipment. Designers will recommend inexpensive materials if the equipment is mass-produced to help reduce purchasing expenses. For one-time use equipment, clients can take an inexpensive approach, while equipment that's constantly being used must be designed to be easily cleaned and disinfected.

market_segmentation.segment: Furniture Design Falls in Line with Consumer Preferences
market_segmentation.segment_description: Furniture manufacturers consult and rely on product designers to make sure new furniture is up to par and will make a splash on the market. Designers assist with the furniture's look, style and aesthetic details to align with trends. They also go over blueprints to ensure functionality. Many design services create digital 3D models of prototypes to get a feel for what a product will look like without shelling out additional expenses to create a physical model. This saves time and money, reduces waste and bolsters sustainability practices.

products_and_services.product_description: Generating a Concept Can Get Challenging. Developing a product design is fundamental and can be a make it or break it point for end users. Services will often break down different aspects of the business to help address problems that customers are facing. While many online websites provide free product concept generation, many customers prefer to rely on services and genuine human interaction.

The pie charts seem to represent the percentage share of "Product Concept Generation" and "Product Research" services in some context, but the exact context is not provided.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Research and Development are the Keys to Success
demand_determinants.determinant_description: The planning stage is arguably the most crucial aspect of the design process. Services will help customers figure out ways to address their clients' problems while reducing long-term costs.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Marketing Effectively is Essential for the End Market
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Product design services help clients determine the best way to enter or expand specific markets. Companies will use data to find a target audience and assess the best way to reach these users. Design services will also generate ways for clients to get consistent feedback to help with future endeavors or upgrades.

business_locations.location_description: The Great Lakes region includes states like Michigan, Ohio, Indiana, Illinois, and Wisconsin.
The Mid-Atlantic region includes states like New York, Pennsylvania, New Jersey, Delaware, Maryland, and Washington D.C.
The New England region includes states like Maine, New Hampshire, Vermont, Massachusetts, Rhode Island, and Connecticut.
The Plains region includes states like North Dakota, South Dakota, Nebraska, Kansas, Minnesota, Iowa, and Missouri.
The Rocky Mountains region includes states like Montana, Idaho, Wyoming, Nevada, Utah, Colorado, Arizona, and New Mexico.

The Southeast region includes states like Arkansas, Louisiana, Oklahoma, Texas, Kentucky, Tennessee, Mississippi, Alabama, Florida, Georgia, South Carolina, North Carolina, Virginia, and West Virginia.
The Southwest region includes states like California, Hawaii, and Alaska.

barriers_points.barrier_title: Low start-up costs and capital requirements
barriers_points.barrier_description: Barriers to entry are low for product design services, allowing for an influx of new companies to join every year. Start-up costs are low and continue to drop amid cloud-based design packages and digital communication.
Buyers dictate the market since they have a variety of design companies to choose from. Even so, some designers offer niche services for specific product lines, slightly reducing buyer power.
Concentration remains low since product designers serve a multitude of downstream industries. The majority of product design services are nonemployers.
The importance of creativity allows for diversity and healthy competition.

Many businesses have in-house design and production teams that work on product design, research and development and marketing. Even so, most companies don't have the financial capability to insource a full design team and will contact design services on an as-needed basis.

factors_decreased_barrier: Low capital requirements allow easy entry

basis_points.basis_description: The basis of competition in the industry is described as 'HIGH competition'.
The basis of competition in the industry is described as 'STEADY competition'.

concentration_points.concentration_description: There are no major players in this industry.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Design services will also generate ways for clients to get consistent feedback
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Design services will also generate ways for clients to get consistent feedback to help with future endeavors or upgrades.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The industry is experiencing a low level of both the rate of new patents and the concentration of patents in the industry. This creates an environment where the threat of new technologies driving disruption is low.

volatility_points.volatility_description: The pandemic caused a shift in consumer behavior, causing many downstream markets to hire product design services to adapt to a new playing field.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: The industry is experiencing a moderate level of technological change.

FAQs.question: What are the key questions for owners in this industry?
FAQs.answer: The key questions mentioned are: LOW regulation vs STEADY regulation, INDUSTRY ASSISTANCE, and VERY LOW assistance vs STEADY assistance.

FAQs.question: What industry data is provided in the text?
FAQs.answer: The industry data provided includes revenue, IVA (industry value added), number of establishments, enterprises, employment, exports, and imports for the years 2005 to 2009. Wage and domestic demand data is missing (shown as 101).
